Image Class¶

class VG.Image(format, dimensions[, quality=VG_IMAGE_QUALITY_BETTER])¶
size¶
the width and height of the image
stride¶
the number of bytes from the start of one row to the start of the next row
parent¶
the parent image if it has one, otherwise None
sub_data(data, format, stride, corner, dimensions[, flip=False])¶
Parameters:
  • data – an object supporting the buffer interface containing the image data
  • format – an enum indicating the byte-format of the data
  • stride – the number of bytes from the start of one row of data to the start of the next
  • corner – I forget.
  • dimensions – I forget.
  • flip – whether or not to flip the data vertically while reading it

Writes data from a buffer into the image.

get_sub_data(buffer, area, format, stride)¶
Parameters:
  • buffer – an object supporting the buffer interface into which the image data will be written
  • area – a nested tuple of the form ((x,y),(width,height)) specifying the region to be written
  • format – an enum indicating the byte-format to be used
  • stride – the number of bytes from the start of one row of data to the start of the next

Writes data from the image into a buffer.

clear(pos, dimensions[, color=None])¶
Parameters:
  • pos –
  • dimensions –
  • color –

Fills the specified area with color or the current VG_CLEAR_COLOr if color is None

make_child(pos, dimensions)¶
Parameters:
  • pos –
  • dimensions –
Returns:

an Image whose contents directly reference the area on its parent
write(src, dest_pos[, area=None[, dither=VG_FALSE]])¶
Copies part of the source image onto this image
draw([mode=None])¶
Parameter:mode – list stuff here

Draws the image to the screen

VG.write_image(src, dest_pos[, area])¶
VG.write_buffer(buffer, dest_pos, dimensions, format, stride[, flip=True])¶
VG.write_to_buffer(buffer, area, format, stride)¶
VG.write_to_image(dest, dest_pos, area)¶
VG.copy_pixels(dest_pos, area)¶
